content: *single_crochet decrease in flo single_crochet 1* 16 round 20 single_crochet in flo around 16 rounds 21-23 single_crochet in each st around 16 finish stuffing fasten_off and weave in ends the top will remain open for now move onto the wick next because you will need that piece before the top/cover piece can be started wick using white chain 15 in 2nd chain from hook slp st in the next 5 sts leaving the last 7 chains unworked fasten_off and tie a basic knot using the 7 unworked chain stitches © airavocreations 4 top/covering piece using black use a mc - you can use the chain method if you prefer see #3 of pattern notes round 1 single_crochet 8 in mc - b​ efore tightening the mc -​ work the wick piece through the center opening and pull mc closed to tighten around the wick with the knotted end on the bottom of top piece to encase the knotted end inside the fbomb slp st to beginning st and chain 1 8 round 2 single_crochet 2 in each st around slp st to beginning to join 16 fasten_off leaving a long tail for sewing © airavocreations 5 sew top/covering piece to the base piece i like to use the front loop of the base piece and the top-most loop of the top piece weaving the tapestry needle up & down through those loops of each stitch around for a cleaner edge each piece should have ended with 16 stitches each so the pieces should line up perfectly stitch-for-stitch f using red or color of choice chain 3 row 1 starting in 2nd chain from hook single_crochet in each st across chain 1 and turn 2 row 2-5 single_crochet in each st across ch1 and turn 2 row 6 single_crochet in first 2 sts chain 5 and turn to start next row 2 single_crochet 5 chain row 7 starting in 2nd chain from hook single_crochet in each chain and st across chain 1 and turn 6 row 8-9 single_crochet in each st across chain 1 and turn 2 row 10 repeat row 6 2 single_crochet 5 chain row 11 starting in 2nd chain from hook single_crochet in each st across 6 fasten_off leaving a long tail to surface stitch onto the base piece or you may weave in the tail if you prefer to use hot glue or fabric glue to stick the letter onto the base © airavocreations 6 flame using red yellow orange - or color of choice cut a 2 inch piece of each color you d like to use and unravel each piece into 4 separate strands you will use two fine strands of each color for your flame or 6 strands total of whatever color s you choose fold your flame strands of yarn in half - the folded loop will be the part pulled through the end of the wick insert hook into the end of the wick and draw the red/orange/yellow yarn through the wick
